intro: Selago cinerascens, commonly known as the silverleaf lily, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking silver-green foliage. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in well-drained soils and full to partial sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and woodland settings. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is often cultivated in gardens and natural landscapes.
